H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H4843.def: = state in which a liquid has a sharp, pungent taste; ≈ regarded as unpleasant and unsuitable for consumption; associated with anger and grief

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5397.def: = the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H7423.def: = state or condition of a person unequipped or unwilling to work or be attentive to responsibilities

H2486.def: = exclamation expressing a strong conclusion, rejecting the event to which it refers to as inappropriate behavior

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H8538.def: literally: completeness; hence: = state in which humans are considered morally blameless, with profound moral uprightness and integrity

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1478.def: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H2611.def: = state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

H1214.def: = causative action by which someone severs a link between one object and a larger object of which it used to be a part

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7953.def: = state in which humans can live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3582.def: = state in which humans are unaware of certain information

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H1891.def: = action by which humans are engaged in activities that do not serve any purpose

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H6184.def: = state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H6631.def: = object which derives from or comes from another object, used for plants and, by extension, for humans

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H8300.def: = a person who was able to flee from danger

H6912.def: = to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

12.gl: to be buried > to be killed by death

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6651.def: = causative action by which humans pile up large quantities of objects in one place

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H4403.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H5355.def: = state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H6211.def: = smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction

H5521.def: = a shelter, ◄ made of fragile materials such as leaves and branches, ► for the purpose of protection from rain and sun for both humans and animals; used by people who needed a temporary shelter, such as nomads, soldiers, and farm workers in the field; ≈ by extension, figuratively God's protection over his people, God's shelter for himself; also a metaphor for Jerusalem, the dwelling of God's people; also by extension, a place where ferocious animals can hide in order to attack someone

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H6491.def: literally: to open (someone else's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which deities give humans the ability to see things that they were not able to see before

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H1091.def: = something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H5492.def: = process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

H1589.def: = action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

6.gl: to clap (one's) hands (out of anger, frustration, disgust)
